Key Match Events: Jose Altuve and Jeremy Peña homered as the Houston Astros improved to 7-0 in games started by Yusei Kikuchi by beating the Arizona Diamondbacks 11-5.
Peña’s 15th homer was a three-run shot, capping a five-run sixth inning.
Kevin Newman homered off Kikuchi in the fourth to put Arizona up 3-1.
Chas McCormick tied the game with a two-run single.
Yordan Alvarez’s two-out RBI single put the Astros on top.
Alex Bregman capped the flurry with a bases-loaded walk.
Eugenio Suárez hit his 25th homer in the sixth to bring Arizona within a run.
Peña’s three-run drive into the Houston bullpen in right-center field broke open the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Peña said, 'It’s great to put runs on the board. That’s what we try to do. I feel like whenever we’ve got a lead our pitching staff does a great job of completing the game, so that’s what we try to do — get some runs on the board and let our pitching staff do their thing.'
Kikuchi said, 'I got hit around a little bit today. But I didn’t give up a walk and kept the team in the game, so I’m happy about that.'

Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo said, 'We didn’t execute in some critical times on the mound. We made some mistakes defensively. There’s just a couple of things we can pinpoint that will show up, as it did today, with big crooked numbers and a big score against a team like this when you don’t play it to the level you’re capable of playing.'

Astros manager Joe Espada said, 'That was the swing of the game. Driving that ball the opposite way, which is not easy in this ballpark, to go oppo like that, but I thought overall our approach was really, really good today offensively.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houston increased its lead in the AL West to 5 1/2 games over Seattle.
Arizona holds a half-game edge over the New York Mets for the second National League wild card.
Yusei Kikuchi struck out six, giving him a career-high 183 strikeouts this season.
Kikuchi has a 3.07 ERA since joining the Astros in a trade from the Toronto Blue Jays on July 29, with a 32.1% strikeout rate.
Yordan Alvarez finished with three hits and is batting .410 with 13 RBIs over his last 10 games.
Others: Diamondbacks: C José Herrera returned to the lineup after he was removed from Friday’s game when he was hit on the back of the helmet by Kyle Tucker’s follow-through on a strikeout.
Astros: After returning from a 79-game absence Friday due to a fractured right shin, Tucker did not start but was available off the bench.
INF Mauricio Dubón is dealing with a sore left thumb, which forced him out of Friday’s game after he jammed it diving into first base.
Houston RHP Justin Verlander (3-5, 4.52 ERA) opposes RHP Ryne Nelson (10-6, 4.15) when the series concludes Sunday night.
